text: Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, KBE, KCSS (, , 1933 â€“ 2003) was an Iranian prince and diplomat. He was the son of Aga Khan III. Khan was known as the 4th United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees from 1966 to 1977. He helped shift the focus beyond Europe and prepared it for fix and aide hard refugee issues. He was a strong supporter that the United Nations should work alone. Khan died of cancer on 12 May 2003 in Boston, Massachusetts at the age of 70. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2003 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Massachusetts Category:United Nations High Commissioners for Refugees Category:Princes and princesses Category:Iranian politicians Category:Politicians from Paris
title: Sadruddin Aga Khan
